data.title: Usability: instance scenes at current view position
data.body:
In 2D (and possibly 3D), when nodes are instanced, they are always placed at the origin of the world. This makes me loose time when designing levels because I have to scroll to the origin to get the object and move it back to the place I was editing. The node should instead be positionned where I'm looking at.

In 2.1, a nice addition doing this would also to be able to drag and drop a scene (or right-click create a node) in the main view in order to place it at the mouse position. Currently this is not allowed.

data.title: Instancing with right-click instances all the scenes
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1 beta, Windows 10 64 bits

Repro:
[InstanceDoingMultiple.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/370461/InstanceDoingMultiple.zip)
right-click any of the available scenes in the FileExplorer, and select "instance". Notice the editor will instance all the scenes in the current folder at once (including the opened scene itself, which causes an error).

Expected:
Instance only the selected scene under the selected parent.

data.title: Result of "double clicking" node is unexpected
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 insider preview. Godot steam version.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Someone coming from other engines (editors) would expect node to be centered ([F] keyboard shortcut) when "double clicking" it in the editor. 

Not saying you guys should strive to be like them (please do not be like Unity :) ). It is just common in most editors that bouble clicking shows the item (I might be biased since my all dev experience is on windows)

**Double click in Unity Editor:**
![sparty_double_click](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2006864/16930889/daf46f54-4d46-11e6-867a-98723681cf20.gif)

**Double click in Unreal Editor:**
![unreal_doubleclick](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2006864/16930896/e0b5afde-4d46-11e6-9e1b-3bf1012f7a33.gif)

data.title: "Double clicking" node invokes text edit in wrong place
data.body:
(Windows 10 insider preview. Godot steam edition)

When"double clicking" node text edit pops out and hides node icon. Text jumping around and covering icon is not nice. Text popping out should be at the same position as original text being clicked.

**Steps to reproduce:**
![double_click_unexpected_result](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2006864/16929487/b10a624e-4d40-11e6-90a5-b794b0c8e784.gif)

data.title: Keyboard shortcut [F] (Center Selection) does not work.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 insider preview. Godot steam version (regular version - opt out from betas)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Keyboard shortcut **[F]** (Center Selection) does not work. Although it **does** seem to work when "view" menu is opened before using shortcut. **[Ctrl+F]** (Frame Selection) works perfectly fine.

**Steps to reproduce:**
![focus_misbehaviour](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2006864/16928801/55af1ce4-4d3d-11e6-8a68-c02154796c4f.gif)

data.title: Fix multichar character constant warning
data.body:
Multi-character character constants are implementation defined,
and therefore they are risky to use for use when trying to be compatible
with so many different platforms. Fixes #2540.

I made sure my conversions were correct with:

```
    print_line(itos(0x31545844)); print_line(itos('1TXD'));
    print_line(itos(0x33545844)); print_line(itos('3TXD'));
    print_line(itos(0x35545844)); print_line(itos('5TXD'));
    print_line(itos(0x31495441)); print_line(itos('1ITA'));
    print_line(itos(0x32495441)); print_line(itos('2ITA'));
```

Which prints on my system:

```
    827611204
    827611204
    861165636
    861165636
    894720068
    894720068
    826889281
    826889281
    843666497
    843666497
```

data.title: EditorPlugins for main editors (like 2D/3D/Script) or tools (like AssetLib) need a way to know the "main screen" parent
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot v2.1.beta.official

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
An EditorPlugin indicates it wants the "main screen" edit area (this is the area occupied by 2D, 3D, Script and AssetLib when selected) by overriding `
has_main_screen()` to return true and overriding get_name() to return a string for the name in the panel for selecting it visible.  However that is as far as one can get since the rest of the necessary functionality is missing.  There is no method to:
1. indicate the editor's main screen has been selected visible (unhide your controls),
2. indicate the editor's main screen is about to switch (hide your controls), nor
3. method to call to get the client area for the main screen so the scene of controls may be placed appropriately (and subsequently removed on deactivation) into the scene tree.

Just so we're clear I've attached an image.  The "main screen" as understood by both the API and the current help documentation refer to the area outlined by the green box as the "main screen".  It does not refer to the entire editor window.  There has been confusion when I brought this up on FB and some folks figured I wanted the entire editor window which is not the case (which has its own issues anyways such as appearing over top menus and stuff making it only suitable for popups and dialogs, not a long-lived editor control with large real estate footprint making it unsuitable for the sidebars).

![plugin-screenie](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1862162/16927675/64c83b34-4ce3-11e6-8f74-8a70983ca4b2.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**

myplugin.tscn:

```
//bunch of controls for myplugin
```

myplugin.gd:

```
tool
extends EditorPlugin

var myControl=preload("res://addons/myplugin/myplugin.tscn")

func has_main_screen():
    return true

func get_name()
    return "MyPluginScreen"

func _enter_tree():
    # we actually have nowhere known to place myControl
    # as a child to have it appear in the "main screen" area
    pass

func _exit_tree():
    # correspondingly we have no remove_child(myControl) method to call
    # since we never had anywhere to call add_child(myControl) to begin with
    myControl.queue_free()
    pass
```

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
see above (don't forget a suitable plugin.cfg)

data.title: Fix crash when dropping scene as a sibling of the root node
data.body: Closes #5782.

data.title: Crash on dropping scene as sibling of the root node
data.body:
If you drag a scene from the FileSystem dock and try to drop it on top of the root node as a sibling, the editor will crash. It should just not allow it as it does when you drag nodes already in the tree.

[Sample project](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/369558/instance-crash.tar.gz). To reproduce drag the `instance.tscn` scene from the FileSystem dock and drop it as a top sibling of the root node, as in the following image:

![godot windows opt tools 64_2016-07-18_13-24-58](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5599796/16922387/ad591712-4ceb-11e6-8eb1-218fa8fa949d.png)

data.title: Fix ScriptEditor don't saving the layout when opening a help page
data.body: Fix the script editor don't saving the plugin layout when opening a new help page. Use ScriptEditor::_update_script_names just once when re-creating the layout.

data.title: crash on android with gyroscope
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Android 4.4 (Galaxy note 2), c328693e837f5899b24504caef5a9ee5e4d4cb4e 

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Crash on android device because of gyroscope.

adb logs

```
FATAL EXCEPTION: main
Process: com.godot.game, PID: 29465
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: Native method not found: org.godotengine.godot.GodotLib.gyroscope:(FFF)V
    at org.godotengine.godot.GodotLib.gyroscope(Native Method)
    at org.godotengine.godot.Godot.onSensorChanged(Godot.java:678)
    at android.hardware.SystemSensorManager$SensorEventQueue.dispatchSensorEvent(SystemSensorManager.java:474)
    at android.os.MessageQueue.nativePollOnce(Native Method)
    at android.os.MessageQueue.next(MessageQueue.java:138)
    at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:131)
    at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5602)
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method)
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:515)
    at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:1283)
    at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:1099)
    at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

```

I will try to make android template with current head and test it again.

data.title: Add an extra stretch mode for a "safe zone" on mobiles
data.body:
As mentioned by @reduz in #4134:

> How about instead of changing keep, which I believe what it does is right, we add an extra stretch mode that does this? It shouldn't be too hard..
> like keep / keep_width / keep_heigh / keep_safe_zone or something else?

data.title: Control scaling should be relative to the anchor
data.body:
The scaling of Controls should probably be relative to the anchor. For example, if you set an anchor at Bottom Right, the scaling should operate starting from the bottom left of the screen, not from the Top Left.

Here's an example project which would benefit from this feature: [dpi_scaling.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/369036/dpi_scaling.zip)

data.title: Resizing a DynamicFont by code can corrupt it
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Windows 10, Godot 2.1 https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/c328693e837f5899b24504caef5a9ee5e4d4cb4e, self-compiled with Visual Studio 2015 Update 2

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected): When resizing a DynamicFont by code, it can get corrupt. This was tested with a DynamicFont as a theme's default font.

**Steps to reproduce:** Resize a DynamicFont from code.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome): [dpi_scaling.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/369030/dpi_scaling.zip) - Use the slider at the top left of the screen to change the GUI scale.

data.title: Slider "step" property is only partially implemented
data.body:
The HSlider/VSlider "step" property seems to be only partially implemented. It will work when the user clicks and scrolls mouse wheel at the same time, but won't lock normal mouse sliding to the step values (which makes it quite useless).

It's implemented in **scene/gui/slider.cpp**, starting from line **44**.

data.title: High Level Multiplayer API
data.body:
I think Godot should have a HLAPI for Networked Multiplayer games.  I just discovered Unity3D has this and it pulled me away from Godot for my current project.  

[Here](https://unity3d.com/learn/tutorials/topics/multiplayer-networking/introduction-simple-multiplayer-example?playlist=29690) is the description of how Unity does it.  

[This](http://spark.tools/powerful-game-engine/#Multiplayer) game engine is trying to make multiplayer development easy too.

data.title: Deep Copy / Duplicate for non-Nodes
data.body:
I asked the question here: https://godotengine.org/qa/6193/deep-copy-any-object
But there doesn't seem to be a straightforward way to create a [deep copy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Object_copying#Deep_copy) of any object.

It should be possible to create a copy of any object, by either providing a method like duplicate() or by having access to the constructor of a class through type information.

data.title: MeshInstance morph ID technique with AnimationPlayer caching.
data.body:
In the first of what I hope to be a series of optimizations and improvements to the otherwise fairly limiteded pre-existing mesh morph system, this changes the technique for reading and modifying morph values from string comparsion to a more conventional ID-based system similar to bones in a Skeleton. The AnimationPlayer is made aware of this change and handles it at the caching stage, caching the IDs in the same way as bones are cached.

This should make it a future-proofed technique for animations making frequent changes to the morph tracks (facial animation, ect.). A new signal has been added to the MeshInstance which is emitted whenever the mesh is reassigned, which is needed to signal to the AnimationPlayer that the cache needs to be rebuilt. Some new methods have also been added for handling morph track IDs. Morph tracks can still be handled through the set and get methods (which is needed to retaining access to the them through the property window), so all pre-existing functionality concerning morph tracks should be unaffected, but using the newly added methods is the preferred way of dealing with morph tracks through code.

It's a small internal change, but I think it's a key part of bringing signficant improvements to morph system, and one which I feel I can put forward with confidence right away.

data.title: Select Physics Body Node Instead of Mesh Node
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Any OS, any Godot version

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When selecting objects in the editor window to reposition, it selects the mesh node instead of the physics body it's attached to. What you get is the mesh moving and the collision shape node and (I think) physics body (rigidbody, static, etc) node staying behind. The only way to work around this is to select the node in the node list.

data.title: Editor Undo Only Works If Mouse Is Not On Axis Handle
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 15.10, Godot 2.0.4.1 or Godot 2.1-beta

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Undo only seems to work in a way that after you've transformed or rotated, you then have to take the mouse cursor off the axis gizmo handle and then hit undo. I feel like this is unintuitive as I thought undo was broken all this time.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Change a node's transform or rotation, move the cursor, and then hit undo.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
